sub_title: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)
summary:
"High Traction" agile product owner with 20 years of B2B / retail experience.

Hands on Product Owner - Engage stakeholders to establish business needs, review options and build consensus for agreed strategy. Proven ability to drive new ideas from inception to launched products

E-Commerce Expert - Successfully developing and adapting winning business models and strategies across channels / countries in Europe, North America and Asia

Product Marketing - All aspects of category management support including web / catalog merchandising, customer & product pricing, sales / margin analysis, product information management and promotional planning

Change Management – Navigating complex multi-channel / multi-country / multi-functional environments to understand and deliver business objectives with both business process and IT driven solutions

CAREER HIGHLIGHTS

Staples.com European E-Commerce launch – Business Project Manager from initial strategy through to successful roll out of pan-European platform. Platform was used in Europe and Canada from 2002 until 2009

Staples Canada Mid-Market Channel – Business Owner for new delivery channel targeting businesses with 8 to 50 employees.  Program was copied around the world, generating over $1 Billion in revenue

European Merchandise Analysis System – Defined and ran quick hit Agile Project to merge sales and vendor program information from 26 countries.  System was live from 2009 until 2013

Staples China Website Relaunch – Business / IT Project Lead for replatforming Staples China websites to create single china wide site (previously they were province specific).

Ziggo Integration – Program Product Owner co-ordinating development effort for migration of 2 million residential customers from former Ziggo system onto the new Ziggo CRM system.

F-Secure Product Launch – Product Owner / Scrum Lead successfully launching Internet Security product in four European markets (Ziggo NL, UPC PL, Virgin IE, UPC CH).  

Philips Master Data Management - Product Owner for Product Data Hub within Philips Integrated Landscape.

projects.title: F-Secure Product Launch, Liberty Global
projects.description:
PRODUCT OWNER / SCRUM LEAD - Liberty Global was launching a new internet security product in several markets. I joined as country lead for the Ziggo NL launch, and later lead launches in PL, IE and CH.
>>> Successfully delivered technical and commercial launch of F-Secure internet security product in 4 markets (Ziggo NL, UPC PL, Virgin IE, UPC CH).  
>>> Proposed and implemented fast track, phased approach to allow F-Secure to be included in national Vodafone Ziggo launch promotion

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Ziggo Integration, Liberty Global
projects.description:
PROGRAM PRODUCT OWNER - Liberty Global was integrating its Netherlands cable operations - Ziggo and UPC.
I joined as B2C Program Product Owner, focused on migration of former Ziggo customers to the new platform.
>>> Cross team product owner, responsible for program level user stories which define business needs and required activities across dozens of different development teams (both scrum and waterfall)
>>> Delivered functionality to enable migration of over 2 million SoHo and Residential accounts from legacy Ziggo order entry / business support systems to new shared platform
>>> Streamlined refinement process by introducing story preparation phase with key subject experts
>>> Presentations to the Agile Conference / Agile Practice on various topics including Prototyping Techniques, Business Discovery, Epic Refinement, Given… When… Then… acceptance criteria

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Photometrics Automation, Philips Color Kinetics
projects.description:
PROJECT LEAD / VBA DEVELOPER - Current process to generate photometric images for Philips Color Kinetics business unit was extremely manual. I defined and won a mini-project to automate it.

>>> Worked with Business Unit lead to establish need, agree business requirements and set project timeline
>>> Wrote MS Access VBA tool to extract photometric information from IES files and PDF reports, converting to database format for generation of custom visuals.  VB Script to convert images to EPS files.

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Marketing Content Management, Philips Lighting
projects.description:
UAT LEAD / BUSINESS ANALYST. MCM combines best of breed applications for Product Information Management (Stibo STEP) and  Digital Asset Management (aDAM) I joined the team as a business analyst focusing on Product Information Management and Business Processes

>>> Product Information Management business analyst / subject matter expert on Agile scrum team - two years of intensive Stibo STEP experience gained through daily use of the system
>>> Led Business Validation and User Acceptance Testing, including running two full UAT rounds – set up and ran issue triage process covering both technical issues and business ones.
>>> Business Process Expert representing Lighting on cross-sector Digital process mapping initiative covering both DAM and PIM
>>> Documented Business User Guide / Data Model covering entire global PIM system. including International + Local Content; Translation; Digital Asset Management;  Portal; Publication settings; etc.
>>> Photometrics discovery investigation identifying epics, user stories and strategic decision points for management of complex, Philips Lighting specific data elements
>>> Set up and ran twice weekly Product Data Governance review meeting with key stakeholders, initially to cover field mappings, but expanded scope to cover SAP to STEP inbound data modeling challenges
>>> Worked with external suppliers (Stibo, TASS) to develop detailed technical specifications

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Cambridge Games Factory
projects.description:
OWNER / MANAGING DIRECTOR. Launched and running successful games publishing company focusing on publishing new designers on short print runs – currently have 10 games in print from 9 different designers

>>> Worldwide hobby distribution with games carried by 100s of stores and distributors in North America, Europe, Asia and Australia
>>> “Rome demands BEAUTY” Kickstarter project earned $72K in 3 weeks becoming the first games project to earn more than $50K in funding

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Product Equivalencies, Staples Europe
projects.description:
PROJECT LEAD. Offering lower priced, high margin equivalent products as substitutes is a win for customers and a powerful driver of bottom line profitability. I was asked to improve usage of product equivalencies in Europe

>>> Discovery investigation to determine opportunities for equivalency matching in Europe.  
>>> Benefits roadmap to maximize business value from matching investment
>>> Defined matching process and rules. Playbook review with category managers to define product features and set matching rules for  each product types.
>>> Custom built Oracle PLSQL / Access VBA matching engine, comparing products with similar features to compare entire assortment for potential matches
>>> Initial load of 3rd party (CNET) product feature into Product Data-mart (SAP MDM) to drive both matching engine and selling content on country websites
>>> New interface to split master data and load feature data onto country websites (VB.NET \ XML)
>>> Documentation, training and handover of process to Staples internal team

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Project Management Office, Staples China
projects.description:
PROGRAM LEAD. After my initial contract at Staples China, I was asked to stay on to set up and run a project management office to deliver quick wins while teaching project and business analysis skills to local team.

>>> Repriced Staples China buying guide to drive margin capture from non-sensitive items, improving overall company margin by ~1%
>>> Baseline analysis of customer set up and order processing across different business units to understand ‘as-is’ processes so that we could start stabilizing and improving them
>>> Weekly review meeting with customer service, sales team and inventory management - driving business improvements by finding and fixing concerns at a detailed level.
>>> Customer service empowerment program – piloted and launched in a month.  CSRs allowed to solve any problem on the phone if impact is 100RMB (~$20) or less 
>>> Integrated government and commercial selling channels. Planned and facilitated 3 day strategy session. Kicked off integration 2 weeks later and completed first phase in 3 months.

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Website re-launch, Staples China
projects.description:
PROJECT LEAD. Staples is Office Supplies market leader in China, however the business was managed independently by province, with separate websites and ERP system. I was asked to plan and launch a single website for China.

>>> Relaunched Staples China website (www.staples.cn) on multi-country web-platform developed by Staples Europe.  Shared services strategy now rolled out to 4 continents
>>> Merged Shanghai, Beijing and Shenzhen websites to create a single website for China 
>>> Trained and managed web merchandising team to prepare launch content
>>> Integrated customer service teams to create first China-wide call center team
>>> Frontend website using Staples Europe public web-platform (ASP.NET / SQL Server)
>>> New interface to connect customer and order feeds with provincial ERP systems (ETL \ XML)

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Staples / Corporate Express Acquisition
projects.description:
DATABASE LEAD. Acquiring Corporate Express grew sales by $6 billion (30%), securing Staples position as the world's leading office supplier. I was asked to build a product analysis database to help secure synergy savings.

>>> Technical lead for merchandise analysis database combining sales, purchases and vendor agreements.
US / Canadian database developed in MS Access  (5 business units).
European database developed in Oracle / MS Access (28 business units)
>>> Merged data and mapped common fields (Brands, Vendors, Classes). Calculated program effective rates and applied at product level to provide dead net profit. 
>>> In depth reporting and analysis to support highly successful COGS reduction initiatives in North America and Europe - both projects easily beat synergy savings targets
>>> Transformed initial databases into sustainable programs with quarterly update process. 
>>> Invoice product costs review to align pricing across channels while minimizing any supplier cost increases.

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Database Marketing, Staples US
projects.description:
BUSINESS CONSULTANT. Staples Database Marketing had strong campaign management and predictive modeling skills but was struggling to deliver actionable customer insights. I was asked to help develop  that capability

>>> Foundational customer analysis for core product categories (e.g., Ink, Paper) and other aspects of customer behavior to help develop successful marketing strategies
>>> Customer analysis templates / processes using BRIO and Oracle SQL to reduce development time and increase analytical depth of ‘quick hit’ customer analyses
>>> Business / consumer sales allocation algorithm extended customer insight analysis to unidentified cash / credit transactions (~50% of marketing database)

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Single View of the Customer, Staples US
projects.description:
BUSINESS CONSULTANT. Multi-phase customer data integration project to deliver a shared customer hub across Staples US Retail and Delivery systems. I was asked to help the project achieved its business objectives.

>>> Business value subject matter expert focusing on linking complex new functionality to clear and achievable business benefits.
>>> Interviewed application owners to establish best candidates for initial pilot.  Selected pilot applications (Credit, Tax Exempt) and set rollout strategy and business requirements to maximize financial benefits
>>> Business lead for RFP process, providing business recommendation on customer hub package selection
>>> Communication track lead, responsible for project portal and internal announcements of program rollout
>>> Access / VBA data profiling and testing tools to find issues with complex customer load
>>> User acceptance / end to end testing of integrated systems (Tax Exempt, Credit)

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Mid-Market selling channel, Staples Canada
projects.description:
BUSINESS PROJECT MANAGER promoted to BUSINESS OWNER. Staples Canada was extremely successful selling to businesses with 0 to 7 employees. I was asked to plan and launch a business model targeting mid-sized companies.

>>> Planned and launched new program targeting businesses with 8 to 50 employees
>>> Business owner, directly managing Merchandising and Marketing with dotted line for Account Management and Customer Service (10 reports, $20 million revenue)
>>> Catalog only pilot to reduce time to market and upfront investment – program rolled out nation-wide after three months, a year ahead of schedule.  Added website 12 months after launch
>>> “Jury Rigged” Canadian catalog pricing to allow customer specific price lists – approach was quickly adopted by US for preferred customer program ($1 billion revenue)
>>> MS Access / VBA + BRIO customer profitability reporting merging sales, margin and customer data to give customized 360-degree view of business trends and performance
>>> Unique pricing model using MS Access / VBA + MS Excel sales quote tool / catalog merchandising process to provide competitive pricing (won 50% of quotes) while safe-guarding margin (1% above target)

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: E-Commerce program launch, Staples Europe
projects.description:
BUSINESS PROJECT MANAGER. Staples.com was a pioneer of B2B E-Commerce and now ranks second for worldwide eCommerce sales. I was asked to project manage planning and launch of Staples eCommerce program in Europe.

>>> Opportunity sizing, business planning and financial scenario analysis to plan roll out strategy and timing.
>>> Usability testing in UK and Germany to confirm US look would be appropriate for Europe.
>>> Defined and launched scalable, internationalized platform (using Bizdesk / CS2K) - platform survived for 8 years and was rolled out to 14 countries, 11 languages, 9 brands before it was upgraded.
>>> Set up shared services steering team and support model to add Staples Canada to program. 
>>> Directly managed pre-launch email capture and marketing ($100,000 budget, 2 reports)

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Staples / Office Centre Acquisition
projects.description:
DATABASE LEAD. Staples first European acquisition included stores in Netherlands, Germany and Portugal. I was asked to build a product analysis database to help secure merchandising synergy savings.

>>> Merchandise database and reporting tools combining sales, purchases and vendor agreements for UK, Germany, Netherlands and Portugal (MS Access)
>>> Merged German assortment from 2 chains (Staples + Sigma) in 8 weeks 
>>> Pan-European analysis and category bidding - project beat synergy saving targets

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

projects.title: Merchandise Integration, Staples Europe
projects.description:
SENIOR ANALYST. Staples began it's European operations in the UK and Germany with separate management teams for each country. I was asked to lead analysis for the merchandise integration of the two businesses.

>>> MS Access / VBA + MS Excel product sales and margin analysis including global cost comparisons, vendor rebates, competitor pricing, catalog performance, obsolescence, etc 
>>> Global cost comparison tool, including product costs and vendor rebates for US, Canada, UK and Germany.  Vendor level reporting to support category negotiations - reduced costs by over 10% in 12 months.
>>> Gap analysis comparing margin contribution by category between US, UK and German assortments.  Product level opportunity assessment identifying quick wins and longer term strategies.
>>> Reassigned UK and German product classes to match Corporate hierarchy.

contributors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

authors.headline: Hands On Agile Product Owner (Digital, Prototyping, PIM)

profile_positions.description:
Hands on product owner and management consultant experienced in delivering quick win value using fast and effective agile methodologies

CONTROL - Rapid and intuitive data driven review of current state to understand improvement opportunities.  “You don’t need to reach the summit to know the mountain’s there.”

ALTER - Lead by example to establish agile continuous improvement principles with focus on end-to-end customer value.  “Customers don’t care which team is responsible – they just want it to work!”

DELIVER - Systematically replace chaos of over-commitment and missed expectations with sustained predicable progress.  “If your plane is falling out of the sky, first fix the roll *then* fix the dive.”
profile_positions.title: Product Owner

profile_positions.description:
Following reorganization, Technical Faults team had lost connection to product vision. I was asked to restore team’s ability to deliver measurable business benefits against a clear roadmap.
•	Reprioritized upcoming initiatives to focus on quick win benefits from fixing and optimizing existing technical fault journeys before starting work on new initiatives.
•	Sought out additional tools to evaluate customer experience and mined them for highest priority customer facing issues (e.g,. Content Square, Qualtrics, Community Voice)
•	Demonstrated agile discipline and best practices (e.g., all stories refined before planning, clearly prioritized backlog, no requirement changes mid-sprint, Product owner review of all “done” items)
•	Defined simple “good enough” approaches to resolve team’s biggest technical challenges (e.g., production testing with simulated data, digital operations reporting, email support approach) 
•	Reduced team’s front end error rate from 40% of sessions to 5% in 3 months
profile_positions.title: Product Owner, Technical Faults

profile_positions.description:
Virgin Media O2 was accelerating go to market..  I was asked to set up a digital rapid testlab for proto-typing new commercial propositions with live customers.
•	Defined testing pillar objectives within new “dosed innovation” strategic vision 
•	Repurposed existing test user journey to support multiple commercial propositions and user experiences; launched first live user journey in 6 weeks
•	Used retail “KISS” (Keep it simple stupid) product principles to cut through complexity of telecom product assortment and create dynamic content which can easily be configured in different user experiences.
•	Worked with cross-functional business team to define customer selection and order fulfillment processes to ensure testlab orders could be processed
•	Provided multiple rounds of strategic insights, many of which have now been incorporated into Virgin Media O2’s main commercial website
•	Transitioned new capability to internal team after 15 months;  Testlab is now a key step in the Virgin Media O2 commercial launch process.
profile_positions.title: Product Owner, Digital Rapid Testlab (Remote)

profile_positions.description:
Philips was struggling to implement an Informatica MDM Data Hub to replace and expand product data management capabilities.  I was asked to get the project back on track.
•	Rapidly stabilized sprint delivery by demonstrating and enforcing agile discipline and best practices (e.g., all stories refined before planning, strict sprint prioritization, no requirement changes mid-sprint)
•	Established clear roadmap and release planning / cadence to reset and manage stakeholder expectations. 
•	Implemented new global product data model across multiple source and target applications.  Secured separate scrum team and database partition to maintain legacy flows during transition.  
•	Created UDI regulatory submission flow to FDA / EU MDR (syndication via 1Worldsync)
•	Replaced multiple legacy interfaces to support migration to Philips Integrated Landscape
profile_positions.title: Product Owner - Master Data Management (Product Domain)

profile_positions.description:
